intro: Parabouchetia, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plants typically have small, delicate leaves and produce clusters of showy, often pink or white flowers. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive blooms and compact growth habit. Parabouchetia species are generally shade-tolerant and thrive in moist, well-drained soil.
